body_content.explanation: firm and not changing in your friendship with or support for a person or an organization, or in your belief in your principles:
examples: She became one of my dearest and most faithful friends.
They are faithful supporters of the Labour Party.
His faithful old dog accompanied him everywhere he went.

body_content.explanation: If your husband, wife, or partner is faithful, he or she does not have a sexual relationship with anyone else:
examples: Was your wife faithful during your marriage?
He was faithful to his wife throughout their 30-year marriage.

body_content.explanation: to continue to support or follow something:
examples: He remained faithful to the regime when so many others spoke out against it.

body_content.explanation: true or not changing any of the details, facts, style, etc. of the original:
examples: She gave a faithful account of what had happened on that night.
I have tried to keep my translation as faithful as possible to the original book.
We extend a message of goodwill to all the faithful followers of Islam on this first day of Ramadhan.

body_content.explanation: someone who continues to support someone or something:
examples: He gave a rousing speech to a room full of party faithfuls (= faithful supporters of a political party).

body_content.explanation: people who are always loyal to a particular group or organization, especially a political party:
examples: They asked for donations from the party faithful.

body_content.explanation: the people who believe in a particular religion:
examples: We heard bells calling the faithful to prayer.
